summary: This bill, the "250 Years of Service and Sacrifice Commemorative Coin Act," mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins to honor over 250 years of American service and sacrifice, recognizing the nation's semiquincentennial.  It specifies coin denominations ($5 gold, $1 silver, and half-dollar clad coins), design requirements, issuance dates, and sales procedures. Surcharges from coin sales will benefit the Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Foundation, supporting programs for Gold Star families, first responders, and veterans. The bill also includes financial assurances to prevent government cost.
